channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The fight for Alex Jones' Infowars company heats up as Jones sues to hold on
item.description: The Onion thought it had the last laugh when it was named the winning bidder after last week's bankruptcy auction. Now, Jones says that bid was "fake dollars" and wants a judge to disqualify it
item.content:encoded:
The Onion thought it had the last laugh when it was named the winning bidder after last week's bankruptcy auction. Now, Jones says that bid was "fake dollars" and wants a judge to disqualify it

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Trump picks Dr. Oz to lead Medicare and Medicaid
item.description: In announcing his pick, Trump said Oz will work closely with RFK, Jr. "to take on the illness industrial complex." Oz, a celebrity physician, ran unsuccessfully for the U.S. Senate in 2022.
item.content:encoded:
In announcing his pick, Trump said Oz will work closely with RFK, Jr. "to take on the illness industrial complex." Oz, a celebrity physician, ran unsuccessfully for the U.S. Senate in 2022.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Diane Webber

item.title: Traffic on Bluesky, an X competitor, is up 500% since the election. How will they handle the surge?
item.description: Unlike other social media sites, Bluesky allows users to create their own algorithm. The site does not have ads, nor harvest data for artificial intelligence training. But it is still very small, and it does not make money.
item.content:encoded:
Unlike other social media sites, Bluesky allows users to create their own algorithm. The site does not have ads, nor harvest data for artificial intelligence training. But it is still very small, and it does not make money.

(Image credit: Provided by Bluesky)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Is Israel Using New, Deadly Military Technology in Gaza?
item.description: NPR has been collecting eyewitness accounts from Gaza that indicate Israel is using a new type of drone. One that has a gun attached that can shoot people remotely. We hear how Israel is using it in Gaza and what this technology could mean for the future of warfare.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has been collecting eyewitness accounts from Gaza that indicate Israel is using a new type of drone. One that has a gun attached that can shoot people remotely. We hear how Israel is using it in Gaza and what this technology could mean for the future of warfare.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)

item.title: A GOP lawmaker introduces a Capitol bathroom rule before her trans colleague arrives
item.description: South Carolina Rep. Nancy Mace says the resolution aims to protect women's rights. Democratic Rep.-elect Sarah McBride, the first out trans person elected to Congress, has slammed it as a distraction.
item.content:encoded: South Carolina Rep. Nancy Mace says the resolution aims to protect women's rights. Democratic Rep.-elect Sarah McBride, the first out trans person elected to Congress, has slammed it as a distraction.
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Trump picks Wall Street investor Howard Lutnick as Commerce Secretary
item.description: President-elect Trump picked Lutnick, the CEO of investment bank Cantor Fitzgerald, to be his next Commerce Secretary.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Trump picked Lutnick, the CEO of investment bank Cantor Fitzgerald, to be his next Commerce Secretary.

(Image credit: ANGELA WEISS/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Manhattan prosecutors ask for additional pause in Trump hush-money criminal case
item.description: Manhattan prosecutors are asking for a further pause in the criminal trial against President-elect Donald Trump in order to give both sides time to weigh the unprecedented nature of the situation.
item.content:encoded:
Manhattan prosecutors are asking for a further pause in the criminal trial against President-elect Donald Trump in order to give both sides time to weigh the unprecedented nature of the situation.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: A 'bomb cyclone' is expected to hit Pacific Northwest. Here is what you should know
item.description: A "bomb cyclone" is forecast to bring heavy snow, high winds and life-threatening flooding to the Pacific Northwest in the next few days.
item.content:encoded:
A "bomb cyclone" is forecast to bring heavy snow, high winds and life-threatening flooding to the Pacific Northwest in the next few days.

(Image credit: NOAA)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: As Nadal plays his last tourney, Federer sends an emotional note from 'your fan, Roger'
item.description: "You challenged me in ways no one else could," Roger Federer tells Rafael Nadal, who will retire after this week's Davis Cup tennis tournament.
item.content:encoded:
"You challenged me in ways no one else could," Roger Federer tells Rafael Nadal, who will retire after this week's Davis Cup tennis tournament.

(Image credit: Jack Guez)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Trump's threats of mass deportations lead to hard discussions for families
item.description: About 11 million Americans are related to an immigrant without legal status in the U.S. As President-elect Trump ramps up promises of mass deportations, these families are having hard conversations.
item.content:encoded:
About 11 million Americans are related to an immigrant without legal status in the U.S. As President-elect Trump ramps up promises of mass deportations, these families are having hard conversations.

(Image credit: Yunuen Bonaparte for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd
